editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Scholars of Merton College.

msItem.note: f. irv blank. Written sideways up f. iiv, partly mutilated, is ‘[ ... ] continentur Abbreuiacio seu Reportorium doctoris subtilis super .4. libros sentenciarum / quedam [ ... q]uestio de bona fortuna. Eciam quedam alia questio Vtrum paradisus &c. / [ ... ] tres quaterni 2o fo scibile habet esse in intellectu.’

msItem.author: NICHOLAS BONET OFM
msItem.title: Theologia Naturalis
msItem.incipit: Motor immobilis similiter. Primus cum de numero studentium et scribentium participem
Primus autem in hac nostra theologia naturali est stabilire subiectum
msItem.explicit: concedat sibi uniri et eo frui in eternum. Amen amen amen. Explicit liber.
msItem.note: Pr., with other works of his, Venice 1505.

msItem.title: An index
msItem.explicit: Amen quod Browne. Explicit theologia naturalis magistri Nicolai Boneti ordinis fratrum minorum scripta et finita.

msItem.note: On f. 122, sideways in a rough hand of c. 1500, is ‘?Versor glosat’ abbreuiacio super 4or libros.’ Also, in an earlier hand, ‘do(min)us T. Wynton’. Tewkysbury abbas’. Fols. 122v-3v blank but for a faint pen trial at the head of 123v.

supportDesc.extent:
125 leaves (ii + 123)
170 120
130 85
The edges retrimmed and spattered with red.
supportDesc.collation: A bifolium at each end, 114(lacks 1), 2-614, 7-812, 914; catchwords and leaf-numbers, mostly trimmed off.

layoutDesc.layout: Frame-ruled with crayon, written in c. 32 long lines.

handDesc.handNote: Written in the small neat anglicana-scretary of Browne. At the head of f. 1 he has written ‘Sancte Bartholomee funde preces’.

decoDesc.decoNote: On f. 1 is a red and blue initial flourished in red; otherwise blue initials flourished in red as far as f. 13; thereafter unfilled spaces for coloured initials.

binding.p: Standard Merton s. xvii; sewn on four bands; formerly chained from the usual position. At the foot of fols. i and ii, near the foredge, parchment has been removed, probably to tidy up the rent left by a chain-staple.

history.provenance: On f. iiv ‘B lier.5us.’ in the usual hand (see above, MS 60). Beneath is ‘Liber collegii’, in the same humanist hand as that of the inscriptions in the books given by Thomas Bloxham (e.g. MS 69). Immediately below is a table of contents, possibly in the same hand.
On f. ii are ‘18’ and ‘30us liber’, c. 1500, the second at least presumably referring to a College electio.

At the head of f. 1 is the James no. ‘184’, s. xvii in. ‘14’ is inked on the foredge. Inside the front board is a sheet of paper with contents and ‘F. 7, 12’ (canc.), s. xvii, and ‘O. 8. 5. Art:’, canc. and replaced with ‘M. 1. 5’ in red and ‘(CXC)’ in pencil; the College bookplate.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact Merton College Library.
